page.title: 12POLWARTH BIRDS & SPORTING
page.content: ALL THE COMMON BIRDS ARE FOUND, PARTICULARLY SPARROWS, ROBINS, TITS, STARLINGS, WOOD PIGEONS & THAT RECENT RESIDENT, MOURNING DOVES. THERE ARE ALSO SOME LESS USUAL BIRDS FOUND, GREEN WOODPECKERS, DIPPERS, BARN OWLS & PINK FOOTED GEESE WHICH COME EACH SEPT. TO WINTER ON HULE MOSS & THE NEARBY FARM LAND & LEAVE IN APRIL TO RETURN TO NEST AT SPITZBERGEN. GOOSANDER, MERGANSER, POCHARD, MALLARD HAVE ALL BEEN FOUND ON GREENLAW MOOR. GROUSE & PARTRIDGE & SOME PHEASANT ARE INDIGENOUS, THOUGH PHEASANT HAVE BEEN INCREASED BY REARING OR PUTING DOWN AS THIS IS A FINE SPORTING AREA. THERE ARE ROE DEER GENERALLY TO BE FOUND ON THE BACKLEA ON THE HIGHER GROUND BY KYLES HILL, THOUGH THEY COME DOWN LOWER DURING THE WINTER MONTHS TO FEED IN THE GREEN RIDE OR IN THE MARCHMONT POPICIES.
